author: jta
msg: Addressing (partially) web site format issues raised by Dan Debrunner in [1]
and by Michelle Caisse in [2].
[1] http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/db-derby-dev/200603.mbox/%3c442D6949.2070903@apache.org%3e
[2] http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/db-derby-user/200604.mbox/%3c4431977A.9020406@sun.com%3e
The basic points:
(1) The "Quick links" subcategory on the home tab really should autoexpand
but can't because  http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FOR-339 feature
not implemented yet.
The resolution is to not have a Quick links subcategory on the home tab,
just a simple list.  But I'm leaving the subcategories in place on the
Resources tab because of the high number of items.
(2) A "Quick Start" entry on the home tab and its own tab is "disconcerting".
The resolution is to remove the link from the home tab -- it isn't needed
because the home page also links to it.
(3) Links on the home tab that are repeated on other tabs (for example, a
license link on the Download tab and an FAQs link on the Community tab)
cause a jump back to the home tab when the page is selected.
I agree this behavior is jarring, but don't see a way to avoid it. The
best near term solution is to not repeat links across tabs and to choose
carefully where those links should appear. I think "license" and "FAQs"
both need increased visibility, so left them on the home tab. I also left
"Derby Wiki" on the home tab because the Community tab has quite a few
items.
(4) Offsite links should open in a new window.
I haven't figured out a way to do that in the forrest menu; the forrest
class="fork" style that works in the body of a page is accepted in the
site.xml but has no affect.
The best resolution for this for now is to remove those links, but for
another reason as well: keep the number of items on the home tab few
enough that people will notice what's there.
Not able to address yet:
On the download tab if you click on 10.1.2.1, the navbar collapses instead
of highlighting 10.1.2.1

author: ate
msg: Fixing JS2-511.
NPE's thrown from hashCode() methods as result of commons Digester trying to log (using .toString()) digested objects when logging level is set to DEBUG
See: http://issues.us.apache.org/jira/browse/JS2-511
Note: I saw a lot more "interesting" output in jetspeed.log with rootLogging level set to DEBUG ...
